title: cafter
author: cafter
content: Means refering from crypto related site like nexo, binance, etc. this is kind of affiliate marketing,I had tried by running ptc ads on PTC site (no google adsense or facebook ads) I didn't got results(which is obvious why someone invest in nexo if he is trying to earn through PTC sites)  how you refer what do you do to convince anyone to make account on sites. like you have blog, website, etc. i heard on this forum, some people said i had over 100 referral. i also want that much referral, can you suggest some ideas?

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Paid to click (PTC) will draw online traffic from people aiming to earn money from home. This does not mean that they will be familiar with digital currencies and blockchain applications. Traffic should be more specific.As for earn from referral links, It all depends on the content you provide on your website or blog where you will persuade visitors to click on the link. There are many free online tutorials and YouTube videos that explain how a successful referral program works.In general, referral programs in the crypto field are not very profitable due to the limited number of users in this field. If you are a beginner, I advise you to focus on an easier niche.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Most of the crypto referral programs are just all scams, with their higher promising reward for each referral.. all that I have joined all ended up scams, and they bring up one excuse after another not to reward users. Sometimes we just wake up and notice the sites are no more. Some will end up telling you to make a first deposit to their platform to prove that you are human and not a robot or a scammer, or whatever they will twist the story to look like. I have actually not received any reasonable referral reward from any crypto platform, so I gave up before I became the victim of another time-wasting scam.

comments.author: Lorence.xD
comments.created_time: March 30, 2023, 10:01:39 PMLast edit: March 30, 2023, 10:39:59 PM by Lorence.xD
comments.body: The worst part is when you invited like three people, the site would eventually tells you to do some tasks in order to receive the prizes. Once you done it it will just continue to on giving tasks until you haven't notice you've done a lot and still not getting the money. Sometimes referrals will give you money for each invited but its not a full money its like 1/4 of the mentioned prizes. For you to get it in whole you'll have to follow it. Influencers mostly benefits from this since a lot of follower would try to earn from their idols. When the site like rugpulled they will just alibi that they are paid to advertise it.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: I earned around 0.2 BTC total through referral programs in crypto casinos, but that was many years ago when Bitcoin was much lower. And I did some very light advertising, people who spent more time on it, like making a dedicated blog, earned much more. Referral programs can be very lucrative if you have a large audience. And what's important is that the audience should be likely to use the service.

comments.body: Quote from: cafter on March 30, 2023, 05:01:14 PMMeans refering from crypto related site like nexo, binance, etc. this is kind of affiliate marketing,I had tried by running ptc ads on PTC site (no google adsense or facebook ads) I didn't got results(which is obvious why someone invest in nexo if he is trying to earn through PTC sites)  how you refer what do you do to convince anyone to make account on sites. like you have blog, website, etc. i heard on this forum, some people said i had over 100 referral. i also want that much referral, can you suggest some ideas?Sometimes the terms and conditions guiding these referral benefits are not explicit. These firms will keep giving you more conditions before you might be paid. They might say you should refer three people but after that, you will be told that until they make deposits you will not get your referral bonus. Getting people to register was very challenging and convincing them to make a deposit was not easy so I gave up the task of bringing people. I have heard about people making a few bucks from referrals, maybe they met the right people and crypto firm at the right time. But you need a large followership on social media for you to make money from social media adverts.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on March 30, 2023, 05:01:14 PMMeans refering from crypto related site like nexo, binance, etc. this is kind of affiliate marketing,the matter is very complex, but in fact, it is simple. it all depends on when you join an affiliate program and what your referrals are like, whether they are active or not. For example, very early on I only had a couple of referrals on the cex.io platform and I converted all the profit from that into Dogecoin. at some point, I had about 95k Doge from it. I leave it to you to think at what moment I sold them.  QuoteI had tried by running ptc ads on PTC site (no google adsense or facebook ads) I didn't got results(which is obvious why someone invest in nexo if he is trying to earn through PTC sites)the worst way to do it is because PTC programs are only for building website traffic, they are often served by bots that are completely useless for affiliates. No leads from there.Quotehow you refer what do you do to convince anyone to make account on sites. like you have blog, website, etc.i heard on this forum, some people said i had over 100 referral. i also want that much referral, can you suggest some ideas?blog, email, social media etc.. are probably the best channels for promotions. you can also use some platforms like Medium, Steemit, Quora and similar. also, keep in mind that you must not advertise in related categories. Some platforms do not allow leaving referral links, like this forum.You will not offer Binance referral links to cooking and recipe pages. today it is very difficult to reach a new Binance user who will be active, certainly not on a PTC site.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: I have one crypto niche blog where I mostly promoted my Binance referral link and I was able to get 25-30 referrals if I can remember correctly. But it was my bad luck that most of them turned out not to be active. I have got a referral bonus from 2 accounts only. The amount is 0.004 BTC which I think is great. Once again, both got inactive these days. It's pretty hard to get referrals from the blog these days, especially when you are promoting exchanges like Binance. Everyone in the crypto space knows the name.However, I think it's better to promote through google ads which pay off though I haven't tried. Also. promoting an exchange that has the potential to reach at the top is a far better idea I think.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Do you think someone with a background in cryptocurrency will click on crypto referral links from ads or Paid to click (PTC)? Brain assumes that it is a fraud, so it avoids it, and many of these links use tools that exploit the resources of your device in mining.In short, to attract a person to click on crypto referral links, which is either to be influential, to help him solve a problem, or to give him advice, and then he will click on those links of his own free will.
